title: Bi-Weekly Career and Hiring Discussion Thread
selftext:
Hello r/india! If you need any suggestions/help regarding your career, ask here. If your company is hiring or if you are looking for a job, then post here.

**If You or YOUR COMPANY is HIRING:**

1. Name of the company
2. Location
3. Requirements
4. Preferred way of contacting you

**If You are looking to get hired**

1. Your skillset/experience
2. Portfolio (if any/applicable)
3. Location
4. Preferred way of contacting you

Please do not mention your emails. You can/should prefer to take conversation forward in PMs instead to avoid any privacy mishaps.

Do follow up here with your experience. Did you get a job or hire someone successfully via these threads? Your feedback helps!

**The Career Thread is posted every two weeks on Thursday mornings.**

https://preview.redd.it/osdztmrfx8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=dab56a83877ffe7dc6fd93767a8f63e9c366e592
comments:
My company is hiring for exp 3 to 14 years
1. Xoriant 

2. Pune

3. Skills required - angular 8 or above, html, css, js, ts, java, microservices, selenium, api/ui automation, c#, asp. Net, web API, MVS, SQL, Nodejs, Python, OCR, Data extraction, Azure, Big data Spark, Scala, Springboot. (Not all skills required for one profile) 

4. U can dm me for referral.

Looking for SEO specialist (Senior level to handle a team). Experience in Gaming niche is considered.

DM me for more details.

Salary: Approx 12Lakhs+

HIRING (1 month Temp) - Programmer/Coder/Developer to product HTML Emailers and Banners. Agency experience preferred but not necessary. 

Location: Work from Home, must have strong/good internet connection. 

Company: Ad agency based in Dubai, so workdays are Sat-Thurs

Please DM me for details

Hiring Angular devs full time.

Location: Mumbai, Bangalore. Can also work with remote for the next 6 months or so.

Will putting udemy or coursera or any MOOC certificate on my resume make it a bit better? I've heard it won't help much, but just to fill the empty space in my resume, is it ok to put or should I avoid?
You should. Put relevant certs to the role you’re applying for and if you’re still learning, go after specializations from organizations that are well renowned. It shows intent to learn!

Hiring Graphic Designer and Space/Visual Merchandiser.

Location: New Delhi.

DM me for details.
Will this be completely remote (for perpetuity, even after covid)?
Not sure about completely remote or not but we are no way going to workplace until pandemic is all over. The admin team just keep extending the WFH from last year.

Job wanted, I am an engineer with 1 year experience with sde and data science with Siemens and 6 months internship experience with Samsung Semiconductors. I am looking for a job in the fields of vlsi, embedded systems, sde or data science and I have experience with all these fields. Please let me know if you have any openings for the same which I can try out for. Will share more details on dm if required. Thank you.
Location:- Bangalore

I got rejected after an interview in which I thought I did decent. I got a standard mail saying you do not meet their requirements. I wish I could know where I went wrong.

Is it bad to ask for a feedback right after an interview to the panel?

It's perfectly fine to ask for feedback. Usually, it's the HRs that don't share the feedback.
Connect with your interviewers directly on LinkedIn: send them a connection r request, and then seek feedback.
If you're applying to a good company (think non tcs/accenture/..), yes, it will help. Bonus points if you have made some project during that course.
can I ask for feedback at the end of the interview when the interviewer asks whether I have any questions?

you can, but the interviewer will probably avoid giving you any "real" feedback. The reason is that most companies have a policy against it :(

In the questions after the interview, ask genuine questions that you're interested in - what's the team like, what has the interviewer's personal experience with the company been like, what are the major tech challenges being faced by the company ..

For large companies, it is often the case that your interviewer is not part of the team that you're being interviewed for - in that case, they might just end up saying "well, I don't know - you will have to ask your hiring manager".

Therefore it is better to ask questions about their personal experience.

-- --

The company policy is simply to protect the company's image. In the past, I've tried sharing honest feedback with the candidates, only to have the candidate backlash at me and telling me that everyone at my company is shit and he knows so much more. That candidate then proceeded to make a social media post about how the interviewer was so rude.

You can. Many people do it. Just be prepared to answer questions related to the courses you put on your resume.

Another thing, they will help out only if the person in charge (HR Or the interviewer) thinks so.

I wouldn't strongly recommend pinging interviewers, especially if you were interviewed by multiple folks.

It would be super awkward for the interviewer to respond in my personal opinion. In most MNC, it's recommended to not share the feedback directly to avoid any legal complications. The recruiter should share a summary of feedback.

9 out of 10 times, the awkwardness lies in our heads.

Just reach out to people for feedback and help - you will be surprised to know that most people are genuinely helpful and open :)

Hiring Embedded validation/test engineer
Experience: 7 years and above.
Location: Bangalore/Pune
Kindly dm for details.
Make projects also for these certifications , will help your profile alot.

I have been working as Mechanical engineer for the past 8 years(3 in India and 5 abroad) in the Oil and Gas construction field. Though the pay is good, I would really like to stay closer to home and have been searching for a job which will enable me to do so. As jobs in my own field are too few to come by , I was thinking of switching to IT/Software field. I really liked to code in my school and college days and have been studying Python online. What I would like to know is what field I should choose to specialize in and what are my chances in that particular field as basically a fresher. I earn about 10-11LPA now but would be fine with half that back home.

Hey guys, Im looking for an internship/assistant role in the UAE. (remote as i cannot travel to the country yet)

I have done previous internships in marketing and HR.

If you know of any job openings, kindly let me know
Thanks!
